Title: Is Global AI Cooperation Even Possible?
Description:
The episode investigates the escalating AI rivalry between the US and China, triggered by the release of both nations’ AI strategies. It examines China’s reaction to the US approach, including its call for a World AI Cooperation Organization based in Shanghai, and the intensifying dispute over NVIDIA’s H20 chip exports. The conversation explores whether meaningful international cooperation is possible or if an AI arms race is unavoidable. Key topics include the strategic use of open-source models, differing visions for global AI governance, and debates among national security experts on export controls.
